posts.post_content:
This is probably one of the most frustrating cards in the universe to have used against you, in my experience. Even more frustrating with Gorgon Flail. Tap, boom. Tap, boom. Tap, boom. God. Any deck that plays fat creatures without shroud hates it with a fiery p\*\*\*ion. (Green, I'm looking at you.)  
  
Would I use it, though? Hell yes. 4/5.

posts.post_content:
Sparkmage isn't *strictly* better - but yes, it's better for almost all practical purposes. If you have to resort to attacking or blocking with this guy for some reason (admittedly, not what you ideally want to be doing, but crap happens) you'd rather have this guy than the sparkmage.  
  
However, even knowing this, given a choice of which one to include in my deck I would indeed go with Sparkmage every time.  
  
I think the Q-Spike comments are referring to giving this guy Deathtouch, not to the Spike's other ability.
posts.html:
Sparkmage isn't strictly better - but yes, it's better for almost all practical purposes. If you have to resort to attacking or blocking with this guy for some reason (admittedly, not what you ideally want to be doing, but crap happens) you'd rather have this guy than the sparkmage.

However, even knowing this, given a choice of which one to include in my deck I would indeed go with Sparkmage every time.

I think the Q-Spike comments are referring to giving this guy Deathtouch, not to the Spike's other ability.
